titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 146
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Augustine, De verbis Apostoli (Sermones ad populum)

watermark.term: Three flowers with stems intersecting in a swastika-like formation.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil. tatis arbitrium

collation.catchwords: Catchwords on all quires except for no. 7

p.note: In-between and is enclosed a paper note with the words Sermones Augustini in Apostolum Paulum in pencil in a modern hand.

binding.p: Early modern binding. Brown leather over wooden boards. 3 raised bands and endbands. , faint writing in ink: Sermones Augustini; in ink: MS 23; stamped in gold: A 146; in brown ink on paper label: 21; in brown ink on paper label: e. 30. 3. 8.; remnants of paper label with the signum 72.
binding.decoNote: , multiple blind tooled concentric panels filled with geometric and floral patterns at the centre of which a medallion surrounded by 4 floral sprigs; floral sprigs and panel borders on .

history.provenance: Provanance unknown. The manuscript is listed in Jaches' catalogue of 1698 (U 122) as no. 72, as no. 21 in the catalogue of 1734 (U 125e), and as e. 30. 8. 3. in Hammarsköld's catalogue of the 19th century (U 133). The signum 23 has not been identified.

msItem.title: Sermo CXXXI
msItem.rubric: Incipit sermo primus sancti augustini de uerbis apostoli Cum tremore et timore uestram ipsorum salutem operamini
msItem.explicit: ut mutentur oremus conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXIII
msItem.explicit: uerissime respondetur Gratia dei per dominum nostrum ihesum christum conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXVI
msItem.incipit: De diuinis lectionibus quod dominus ammonere dignatur
msItem.explicit: sursum cor ponite et de gracias agite

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXIV
msItem.explicit: Sed clamat tibi ihesus sine pueros uenire ad me Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXV
msItem.explicit: qui se humiliat exaltabitur

msItem.title: Sermo CLVI
msItem.explicit: Heredes quidem dei coheredes autem christi Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo XXVI
msItem.explicit: et terra nostra dabit fructus suos Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLIII
msItem.explicit: Vbi habundauit peccatum superhabundauit gratia Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLIV
msItem.incipit: Hesternam lectionem de sancti apostoli pauli epistula
msItem.explicit: Non tamen uirtute tua sed gratia dei per ihesum christum dominum nostrum Conuersi

msItem.title: Sermo CLV
msItem.incipit: Hesterna lectio sancti apostoli eo usque
msItem.explicit: non propter merita uestra sed propter munera sua Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXV
msItem.explicit: Magna scientia ista confidentia Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo XXX
msItem.incipit: Sine dubio fratres grauem quandam sarcinam
msItem.explicit: qui misit me traxerit eum Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CCXCIV
msItem.incipit: In natale sancti iohannis inter cetera
msItem.explicit: quia postea diligenda non erit impietas Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXIX
msItem.incipit: Ad apostolicam lectionem aures et animum
msItem.explicit: quam cursor preter uiam Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLVIII
msItem.explicit: si deus pro nobis quis contra nos

msItem.title: Sermo CLIX
msItem.explicit: fons uincit sicientem

msItem.title: Sermo CLXI
msItem.incipit: Apostolum beatum audiuimus cum legeretur corripientem
msItem.explicit: ille faciunt quod non licet

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXVIII
msItem.incipit: Beati apostoli epistula cum legeretur de constituendis
msItem.explicit: carnalium fena consumet

msItem.title: Sermo XXVII
msItem.explicit: istorum occultorum apertissimam rationem

msItem.title: Quaestio LXXI
msItem.explicit: debeamus diligere propter christum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXIV
msItem.incipit: Omnes nos per apostolum admonet ueritas
msItem.explicit: ut inuicem onera nostra portemus Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLVII
msItem.incipit: Sicut apostolum dixisse meminit sanctitas uestra
msItem.explicit: quia ueracem promissorem christum fidelissime retinentis

msItem.title: Sermo CLXVII
msItem.incipit: Apostolum cum legeretur audistis immo omnes
msItem.explicit: ueniet qui exiget

msItem.title: De eo quod scriptum est in Actibus Apostolorum: Erant eis omnia conmunia
msItem.incipit: Legimus in libro qui apostolorum actibus adscribitur
msItem.explicit: dictum est non mentiti estis hominibus sed deo

msItem.title: Sermo XCIX
msItem.explicit: gloriam consecutam quam in christo suo conditore suscepit qui uiuit et regnat in secula seculorum amen

msItem.title: Sermo XLIII
msItem.explicit: crede ut intelligas uerbum dei

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXX
msItem.incipit: Prima lectio que nobis hodie recitata est
msItem.explicit: tam magno malo carebitis Conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXXI
msItem.incipit: Beatissimus iohannes apostolus salubriter et ueraciter scribens
msItem.explicit: exibimus hinc sine peccato

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXXII
msItem.explicit: pro uobis orate adiutorem conuersi ad dominum

msItem.title: Sermo CLXXXIII
msItem.explicit: qui gloriatur in domino glorietur. Conuersi ad dominum
msItem.note:
The last part of the sermon appears on (Precatio post sermonem), after the insertion MsItem 1.31, but in the form corresponding to the Precatio post sermonem found in PL
and not that printed as the end of Sermo CLXXXIII.

msItem.title: Sermo de Hymenaeo et Alexandro
msItem.explicit: qui numquam discedit a christo

msItem.title: Precatio post sermonem
msItem.incipit: Conuersi ad dominum deum patrem omnipotentem
msItem.explicit: spirituales cogitationes concedat et ad beatitudinem suam perducat per ihesum christum filium suum qui cum eo uiuit et regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum AMEN
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt sermones beati augustini episcopi de uerbis apostoli feliciter

note.p:
The contents of the collection follows that given by Verbraken
with some exceptions in the order of the sermons and the omission of his items 65, and 96-98. The numbering of the sermons follows the numbering of the respective editions.

supportDesc.condition: Several holes in the parchment, though not affecting the text. The corner of severed, with traces of stitching visible. In three of the corners of and two of the corners on are holes caused by corrosion and/or friction from the bosses in the original binding; several holes extend to the adjoining leaves - in the upper left corner of , all the way to with stains all the way to .

layout.note: Ruling in lead point. Pricking visible.

p.note: At least three contemporary layers of additions and corrections, one of which in the main hand.
References to Migne in pencil in a modern hand.

decoDesc.p: Main text in black ink. Sermon rubrics in red.
decoDesc.decoNote: plain openinging initial A over 5 lines in green ink with some penwork and interior reserved shapes. plain sermon initials over 2-5 lines in red ink with occasional penwork and/or interior reserved shapes. , plain sermon initials over 2 and 3 lines in green ink with flourishing in red. Guideletters visible.
